snippet: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner has said very little about the crisis that has led the nation’s currency to plunge.
abstract: Argentine Pres Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner has yet to address currency crisis that has set off global concerns about the fragility of developing economies; Kirchner's absence during steepest currency plunge since country's economic collapse a decade ago has weakened her once-strong public image and fueled debate over whether a power vacuum is emerging.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and JONATHAN GILBERT
byline.contributor: Fabián Werner contributed reporting from Montevideo, Uruguay.

lead_paragraph: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner has said very little about the crisis that has led the nation’s currency to plunge.

headline.main: As Argentine Peso Falters, President Keeps a Low Profile
headline.print_headline: Cash Crisis: Silence in Argentina, Vague Signals in Turkey
